name: Casas-Alvero conjecture
summary: The Casas-Alvero conjecture is an open problem in mathematics concerning univariate polynomials over a field of characteristic zero. It states: If a polynomial \(f\) of degree \(d\ge 1\) has at least one common root with each of its first \(d-1\) derivatives, then \(f\) must be a power of a linear polynomial (i.e., it has only one distinct root of multiplicity \(d\)).
head: a univariate polynomial \(P(x)\) of degree \(d\) has a non-trivial common factor (i.e., a common root) with each of its first \(d-1\) derivatives \(P^{\prime }(x),P^{\prime \prime }(x),\dots ,P^{(d-1)}(x)\)
tail: \(P(x)\) is a power of a linear polynomial, meaning it has only one distinct root (of multiplicity \(d\)).
